result.execSummary:
The defendant Glen R. Decker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture or Deliver Prescription Drug, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(9)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Walworth County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Pay $250.00 fine plus costs.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
---------------------------

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
---------------------------

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence.
---------------------------

No alcohol. No drugs except with a valid prescription.
---------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.   The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.
---------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
---------------------------

timeConds.notes: with work release privileges. Conditional Jail time is STAYED for use by Agent

records.addlTxt: Defendant Glen R. Decker in court with attorney Jason Sanders.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.

Defendant Glen R. Decker in court with attorney Jason Sanders.  Andrew Robert Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 11, 2016 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for August 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved.

Court in session at 2:30 pm.
Defendant Glen R. Decker in court with attorney Jason Sanders. Matthew Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State calls first witness Lori Domino who is duly sworn by clerk and responds to direct exam of ADA Leusink. Exhibit #1 identified as Criminal Complaint. Witness identifies defendant. 
2:32 pm - Cross exam by Atty Sanders. 
2:35 pm - No redirect by ADA Leusink
2:35 pm - Argument by Atty Sanders. No argument by ADA Leusink.
Court finds probable cause and binds matter over for trial. Information filed. Not guilty pleas entered and trial reserved. 

  Status conference scheduled for April 14, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Glen R. Decker in court with attorney Jason Sanders.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Preliminary Hearing requested within time period. Minutes filed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant Glen R. Decker appeared, Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
SPD Notice of Eligibility - need time to appoint counsel
Signed bond filed with the court.

NO PRESCRIPTION MEDICATION WITHOUT A VALID PRESCRIPTION
Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Any prescribed medication is to be taken within the terms / limits of the prescription.  Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH S.C.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Defendant Glen R. Decker appeared, Andrew Robert Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 27, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
